Vehicles in Madagascar drive on the right hand side of the road which is rare for an island country. The vegetation is rather unique and generally tropical. Madagascar uses utility poles featuring ‘dents’ in them. Houses in Madagascar often have reeds comprising the roof (or corrugated iron). In terms of trees, coconut palms are also fairly common. You can also see the sea and beaches in Madagascar, they are mainly found along parts of the east coast.

The climate of Madagascar generally varies from extremely dry in the southern and central parts, to tropical in the north.

Specific tree:

There are trees called Baobabs in Madagascar. These trees are unique to the area at the West Coast east of Morondava.
